title: Shifting

en: A client you've been working with e-mails you - they need the job done a full week sooner than originally anticipated. You'd have to pull an all-nighter to get it done, and even then you're not sure you can.

yes_caption: Put your nose to the grindstone.
no_caption: Apologize for not being able to accomodate them, but stick to the original deadline.

en: You work with intense focus (and several cups of coffee) to finish the job overnight. It's not perfect, but the client is ecstatic and sends you a nice bonus for the work.
The client understands, but sounds disappointed. You do eventually finish the job, but you get the feeling you won't be receiving work from them again in the future.
